content: AFAIR, this was discussed before but I can't quickly find the previous discussion. What do you think about using Quot r everywhere as a type and adding [IsEquiv r] to theorems that need r to be an equivalence?

The main pros of this approach I see are:

  • one can define a type as Quot in */Defs.lean, then prove that the relation is an equivalence later in */Lemmas.lean;
  • we can have [IsEquiv _] instances for other bundled equivalences like docs#Con while using the same Quot type.

The main con I see is a big Mathlib migration.
A separate question: should we deprecate, then drop docs#HasEquiv and usage of docs#Setoid as a typeclass?
